title: Guanyin
summary: Guanyin, Guan Yin or Kuan Yin (/ˌɡwɑːnˈjɪn/) (Chinese: 觀音) is the Buddhist bodhisattva associated with compassion. She is the East Asian equivalent of Avalokiteśvara, and has been adopted by other Eastern religions including Chinese folk religion.[1] She was first given the appellation of "goddess of mercy" or the mercy goddess by Jesuit missionaries in China.[2] The Chinese name Guanyin is short for Guanshiyin, which means "[The One Who] Perceives the Sounds of the World."[3] On the 19th day of the sixth lunar month, Guan Shi Yin's attainment of Buddhahood is celebrated.[4]
